mdRecord.dcterms:description: Houghton Hall is a country house in Norfolk, England. It was built for the de facto first British Prime Minister, Sir Robert Walpole, and it is a key building in the history of Palladian architecture in England. Colen Campbell began the building in 1722. James Gibbs added the domes. William Kent designed the interiors. Thomas Ripley supervised the building work. http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Houghton_Hall [work]
